get sentiment: Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: bill
get sentiment: Service has improved drastically from the old days, you are now seated by a hostess instead of standing behind a nearby table waiting for them to finish. aspect: Service
get sentiment: The atmosphere's a bit grungy, yes, but the music and the coffee are good. aspect: music
get sentiment: The place was packed but we were able to get drinks at the bar w/out a problem despite the crowd. aspect: place
get sentiment: the service was slow took ten mins to get me a glass of water. aspect: glass
get sentiment: impressive balcony seating and while they forgot to give us the cold appetizers, the waiter and maitre'd more than made up for it by being most accomodating to us. aspect: seating
get sentiment: Only thing we didn't like was the steamed chocolate cake with mint ice creama group of the 4 of us did not want to finish this dessert! aspect: dessert

get sentiment: Includes a diverse array of entrees ranging from Boar (prepared in your choice of either the French or Asian tradition), Mussels, or Pad Thai that grace the menu all at once, each one prepared in a distinctly different and delicate sauce. aspect: Mussels
get sentiment: My only advice is: increase portion sizes; and develop a special drink list. aspect: drink list

get sentiment: If you like an ecclectic crowd and an overall good time where you and your friends can get together whether it be to eat, drink or just play some good old pictionary (they provide crayons and a blank white sheet at every table), go to the Cargo! aspect: sheet

get sentiment: My ceasar salad amounted to some limp lettuce and mayo strewn around a large plate, and the only way I might have died for the mac and cheese is due to natural causes while waiting for it to arrive. aspect: ceasar salad
get sentiment: The waitress never came back to get drink refills and we didn't get water until we were halfway through our dinner. aspect: dinner
get sentiment: Ten minutes later the manager relented and dropped off a glass of water with an upturned nose. aspect: glass of water
get sentiment: While dining on a delicate lamb carpaccio, and grilled skate wing, the owner explained that due to low lunch-time patronage, they may be discontinuing lunch altogether. aspect: owner
get sentiment: The bartender, the wait staff and management all put the customer first and that was clear and much appreciated. aspect: wait staff
get sentiment: Maybe I've just gotten lucky with seating, but I've never had more than a ten minute wait. aspect: seating
get sentiment: It was not the mistake of the frozen lasagna, it was the icy service of the manager which has spoiled this restaurant for me. aspect: manager

get sentiment: The brasserie-style menu remains relatively unchanged, featuring classic bistro choices like frisee salad with bacon, blue cheese and a poached egg, steak tartare, moules and steak frites, and various burgers and sandwiches. aspect: bistro choices

get sentiment: The place was packed and while our food took time to be prepared, our waiter earned points for his sparkling conversation to pass time and for also knowing practically every ingredient of every special under consideration. aspect: food
get sentiment: I've only been in a few times for brunch as it does get quite busy, it's worth it though especially now that they have those amazing Blueberry Waffles. aspect: Blueberry Waffles
get sentiment: The staff were rude and rushed us through our meal, clearing plates and laying down dessert menus while others were still eating their main courses. aspect: main courses
get sentiment: Also, they upped their prices, so I have their old menu, and was surprised when my bill came to over $5 more than it used to (I know, not a huge deal). aspect: prices
get sentiment: Been there a few times for dinner, brunch or just a drink (the French cosmos are fantastic) and it just keeps getting better. aspect: drink

get sentiment: The hostess was condescending and the waiter was somewhat absent and unaccomodating (sure, we made a reservation to sit outside but when I asked to be moved indoors after I heard thunder he didn't even try to make it happen, giving me a blank stare and a shrug when I asked what we would do if it rained). aspect: reservation
get sentiment: Downtown Dinner 2002 - Prixe fix: Appetizers were ok, waiter gave me poor suggestion. aspect: Appetizers
get sentiment: Anyway, I went down on a Wednesday night to see if they had a long wait and the hostess said they had a table to accomodate my party. aspect: table

get sentiment: My vegetable Napoleon was good; although i first got the veggie burger because the waitress mis-heard and stood my friend up for another 15 minutes of waiting to have it served. aspect: waiting
get sentiment: No matter what, you should expect a wait, big deal, small price to pay for great food as far as I'm concerned. aspect: food
get sentiment: yes this place has good pizza but HORRIFIC HORRIFIC delivery service. aspect: pizza
get sentiment: But on a recent Sunday brunch excursion, I was greeted by a uniformly unfriendly staff - starting with the hostess and extending to foul faced wait staff. aspect: hostess

get sentiment: With all of the kitchen goof-ups (appetizer coming out before the entree and one entree coming out ten minutes before the other) you would think that the wait staff would have been more attentive. aspect: appetizer
get sentiment: Sometimes I grow a bit weary of dining in those pretentious, haughty taughty, high fashion eateries. aspect: eateries
get sentiment: The only drawback was slow service, but the food and ambience are so nice that your wait is A) pleasant and B) worth it. aspect: service
get sentiment: Everything from the food to the service was enjoyable about this place, but I can't recommend the tempura shrimp roll with the lobster salad enough. aspect: service
get sentiment: The food was served in small portions and my lamb was pure fat. aspect: lamb
get sentiment: Rich appetizers (baked fontina, lentil cake, french onion soup) and ample, tasty salads. aspect: appetizers
get sentiment: If people are late, you could lose your reservation and/or the staff does pressure you to start ordering even if your whole party hasnt arrived. aspect: staff
get sentiment: The waiter seemed astounded that I ordered no wine or alcohol -- just water -- with my meal. aspect: meal
get sentiment: Ive had better burgers and fries at the local dinner in my neighborhood: 3 guys dinner on 96th and Madison Avenue. aspect: local dinner
get sentiment: I was at Son Cubano a few months ago, and although i was only at the bar (without prior reservations which are a must), i had an awesome time. aspect: bar
get sentiment: The meat, onions, and cheese were good as was the roll, but I'd go back if I could forego the sauce. aspect: cheese

get sentiment: While the staff was kind and attentive, our waiter never once broke a smile, even when I told him it was my friend's birthday, although he did bring a dessert with a candle at the end of the meal. aspect: candle
get sentiment: service was attentive at the beginning but the waiter lost us towards the end and we had to flag them down for the check. aspect: service

get sentiment: Half the menu is comprised of original creations while the other half consists of unique slants on orthodox cuisine such as the single super-sized gnocchi with cinammon. aspect: gnocchi

get sentiment: The Food The versatile Austrian menu, fused with French and American, rewards both high and low-end appetites: rich, cheese-laden onion soup, grilled Gruyere and country ham sandwiches and big-bunned burgers are as satisfying as velvety liver terrine with kumquat-cranberry compote, speck and sausage charcuterie and inexpensive cheese plates. aspect: liver terrine

get sentiment: Amusing details distinguish desserts, from dulce de leche ice-cream profiteroles dotting a chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe board, to coconut custard surrounded by a sea of Malibu-rum gelee and poached pineapple. aspect: chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe
get sentiment: The service was great, the chef even gave me a complimentary dish. aspect: service

get sentiment: The waitress forgot our coffee, took forever to take our order, never checked in with us after the food came and when we were done, didn't bring us the check for the longest time. aspect: coffee
get sentiment: Food was average, the appetizers were better than the main courses. aspect: main courses
get sentiment: The food was served promptly and was really hot. aspect: food
get sentiment: To both our surprise, this inquiry was interpreted as a personal offense by the waiter who told my wife to leave the store if she didnt want the pastries. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: From beginning appetizers, the scallops were incredible, to the delicious chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet, we were delighted by the taste sensations. aspect: chocolate souffle with rasberry mint sorbet
get sentiment: The food was great so that made up for the lack of service from the waitress. aspect: food
get sentiment: The Food The menu features a wide array of Hawaiian- and Asian-flavored appetizers and entrees. aspect: appetizers
get sentiment: The food is delish, you just have to know the manners to consume, if you don't want to be frustrated with the service. aspect: service
get sentiment: My party felt like we got put in a dining room for tourist, which must have been the penalty box area for the disgruntled wait staff on duty. aspect: wait staff
get sentiment: then the manager gave us lemon juice instead of ceasar dressing for a ceasar salad which ruined the salad. aspect: manager
get sentiment: The service was non-existant, the manager spent all of his time at the bar. aspect: manager
get sentiment: (Though the filet won't be enough if both have hearty apitites. aspect: filet
get sentiment: yes this place has good pizza but HORRIFIC HORRIFIC delivery service. aspect: service
get sentiment: The server was so busy the night we visited that she forgot to put in our food order. aspect: server
get sentiment: It's sad that everything about this place was great (even the service and decor) except for the steak. aspect: service
get sentiment: However, it takes ages to get seated (even with a reservation), and the waiters don't seem very knowledgeable about the menu (or receptive to questions). aspect: waiters
get sentiment: Went to celebrate my sisters birthday on 9/11 was 1st taken back on the waiters rude answering of a question we had about the menu. aspect: menu
get sentiment: The smoked salmon appetizer was pretty good (it comes with goat cheese, calpers and onions). aspect: onions
get sentiment: The only apparent flavor in any of the dishes was heat, and a table of four gourmands left at least half of our meals on our plates. aspect: meals
get sentiment: The waitress never came back to get drink refills and we didn't get water until we were halfway through our dinner. aspect: waitress
get sentiment: Not a destination restaurant, but if you're hungry for breakfast or lunch, big portions and good quality for the money. aspect: quality

get sentiment: Amusing details distinguish desserts, from dulce de leche ice-cream profiteroles dotting a chocolate sauce tic-tac-toe board, to coconut custard surrounded by a sea of Malibu-rum gelee and poached pineapple. aspect: desserts
get sentiment: They crumbed the table once, although it was solied the entire meal. aspect: meal
get sentiment: The Black Duck is a great date place, whether going for dinner or just for a drink at their huge, antique-ish bar. aspect: Black Duck
get sentiment: got the guac but no drinks until it was all gone (approximately 20 minutes later). aspect: guac
get sentiment: When my (pregnant) friend asked about a non-alcoholic version of a drink, the answer was simply no, with no further suggestions. aspect: drink

get sentiment: Our spastic waiter was running around like a chicken with his head cut off, and, thus, slow to take our order, slow to bring us our drinks (they sat on the bar for 5-10 minutes) and slow to get us the water we had to ask for repeatedly. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: In Short The vegi burgers (and the full bar) are the main draws: ranging from the Super Veg-Burger with lettuce, tomato and Abijah's secret sauce to the McKate (two un-beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, dairy or nondairy cheese, etc. aspect: Abijah's secret sauce

get sentiment: Ok I got the edamame and something from the sushi chef for free, but the quality of food is more important to me than a free small dish (maybe that's why the restaurant gives it to attact new customers. aspect: quality of food
get sentiment: They are negligent in alerting customers when an order is ready - you could end up waiting for half an hour while your food is sitting on their counter getting cold. aspect: food
get sentiment: I told the waiter that my drink tasted very bad and asked if he could swap it out for a Petron Margarita. aspect: drink
get sentiment: I would have told the wait staff if anyone had asked me if I enjoyed my meal, but no one asked. aspect: wait staff
get sentiment: The portions are small but being that the food was so good makes up for that. aspect: portions
get sentiment: I'm totally into the space-age vibe of this place, but I wish they had more tables to sit down at. aspect: tables
get sentiment: The Food Regulars swear by the tamales, which are spongy, well-seasoned and pulled from steaming crocks on the counter. aspect: Food
get sentiment: The waiter kept coming up and asking to take our plates while we were still eating and the manager stood and stared at us through half our meal! aspect: waiter
get sentiment: The waiter seemed astounded that I ordered no wine or alcohol -- just water -- with my meal. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: For example, we had ordered a 2nd bottle of red wine, the waitress gave me a new glass to taste the wine, but filled up my existing glass (mixing two different bottles in one glass). aspect: bottle of red wine
get sentiment: The manager apologized and gave us back $20 for the difference, BUT THE WAITER NEVER RETURNED THE $120 CASH WE PAID. aspect: WAITER
get sentiment: There is nothing else on the menu except for exotic teas and cold beverages, but with a meal this cheap and delightful, who would care? aspect: meal
get sentiment: Our waiter was not attentive, we waited about 20 mins just to order drinks. aspect: waiter

get sentiment: A friend of mine and I bumped into this restaurant last week and it didn't look like any special place on the outside, but when we looked at the menu we decided to give it a try. aspect: menu

get sentiment: to be honest we only had drinks and appetizers downstairs as we were there for a collegues leaving drinks but the staff was very friendly (typical aussies) and the food i did have was pretty darn good. aspect: staff

get sentiment: The Food Consulting Chef Douglas Rodriguez's forte is blending the diversity of traditional Latin cuisine with modern culinary chic: A celery sorbet cools the spicy-citrus bite of lobster; shrimp seviche and crunchy green plantains coat thick, juicy halibut resting on sweet plantain hash; and tart tomato escabeche moistens a chewy skirt steak. aspect: halibut resting

get sentiment: We were directed to a table by a member of staff, which we were then informed was reserved, and lost our seats at the bar, all this after spending upwards of $30 each on very expensive drinks over a two-hour period. aspect: staff
get sentiment: The old menu items are gone, except for the rib appetizer, which is now bland and fatty, with little trace of the excellent mustard sauce. aspect: rib appetizer

get sentiment: The brasserie-style menu remains relatively unchanged, featuring classic bistro choices like frisee salad with bacon, blue cheese and a poached egg, steak tartare, moules and steak frites, and various burgers and sandwiches. aspect: steak frites
get sentiment: I live about a 1/2 block from Westway and when I want consistantly good food, big portions, great fast service and a step above your average diner food I go there! aspect: diner food
